content.description: <math alttext="F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus S C N with a negative 1 charge, aqueous, is in equilibrium with F e S C N with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, with K sub e q equal to 240 at 25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mtext>SCN</mtext><mo>−</mo></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mtext>FeSCN</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>240</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>at</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mn>25</mn><mtext>°C</mtext></math>
content.question: Equal volumes of <math alttext="0.1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solutions of <math alttext="F e with a positive 3 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S C N with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>SCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are mixed and allowed to attain the equilibrium represented above at a temperature of <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is correct about the system at equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of S C N with a negative 1 charge, is greater than the molar concentration of F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msup><mtext>SCN</mtext><mo>−</mo></msup></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msup><mtext>FeSCN</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="the molar concentration of S C N with a negative 1 charge, is less than the molar concentration of F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msup><mtext>SCN</mtext><mo>−</mo></msup></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mo><</mo><mpadded><mo>[</mo><msup><mtext>FeSCN</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="the molar concentration of F e with a positive 3 charge, is greater than the molar concentration of F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msup><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msup><mtext>FeSCN</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="the molar concentration of F e with a positive 3 charge, is equal to the molar concentration of F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mtext>Fe</mtext><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msup><mtext>FeSCN</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the molar concentration of S C N with a negative 1 charge, is less than the molar concentration of F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>[</mo><mpadded><msup><mtext>SCN</mtext><mo>−</mo></msup></mpadded><mo>]</mo></mpadded><mo><</mo><mpadded><mo>[</mo><msup><mtext>FeSCN</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo></mpadded></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
